message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CY, cs.SI 

This paper focuses on natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning models for affect-related text classification, specifically sentiment/emotion analysis and abusive language detection. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with NLP and related topics. The paper also proposes new representations for words and sentences, which involves training neural network models, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper addresses the issue of model bias, which falls under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The use of hashtags and emojis in constructing emotion-labeled corpora suggests a possible fit with cs.CY (Computers and Society) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) sub-categories, respectively.
